item.title: Cris add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "Choking with dry tears and raging, raging, raging at the absolute indifference of nature and the world to the death of love, the death of hope and the death of beauty, I remember sitting on the end of my bed, collecting these pills and capsules together and wondering why, why when I felt I had so much to offer, so much love, such outpourings of love and energy to spend on the world, I was incapable of being offered love, giving it or summoning the energy with which I knew I could transform myself and everything around me." -- Stephen Fry

item.title: Cris add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Cris add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "I am rooted, but I flow." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Cris add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "But if thought corrupts language, language can also corrupt thought." -- George Orwell

item.title: Cris add a quote by Ferdinand de Saussure
item.description: "Psychologically our thought-apart from its expression in words-is only a shapeless and indistinct mass." -- Ferdinand de Saussure

item.title: Cris add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "One day I will find the right words, and they will be simple." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Cris add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "I swear to you gentlemen, that to be overly conscious is a sickness, a real, thorough sickness." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Cris add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You will always be fond of me. I represent to you all the sins you never had the courage to commit." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Cris add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I don't want to be at the mercy of my emotions. I want to use them, to enjoy them, and to dominate them." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Cris add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "We shall meet in the place where there is no darkness." -- George Orwell

item.title: Cris add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The best books... are those that tell you what you know already." -- George Orwell

item.title: Cris add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "The first draft of anything is shit." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Cris add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Imagining the future is a kind of nostalgia. (...) You spend your whole life stuck in the labyrinth, thinking about how you'll escape it one day, and how awesome it will be, and imagining that future keeps you going, but you never do it. You just use the future to escape the present." -- John Green

item.title: Cris add a quote by John Green
item.description: "When adults say, "Teenagers think they are invincible" with that sly, stupid smile on their faces, they don't know how right they are. We need never be hopeless, because we can never be irreparably broken. We think that we are invincible because we are. We cannot be born, and we cannot die. Like all energy, we can only change shapes and sizes and manifestations. They forget that when they get old. They get scared of losing and failing. But that part of us greater than the sum of our parts cannot begin and cannot end, and so it cannot fail." -- John Green

item.title: Cris add a quote by Rosellen Brown
item.description: "Like deathbed conversions, last paragraph soul-saving does not convince." -- Rosellen Brown
